content:
this link seem to be broken

image.png
http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/uslab-obs-codedresults

do you know how can we find this value set?

Yeah, the SNOMED canonical doesn't actually go anywhere unfortunately. (SNOMED International is aware, but I'm not sure if they have a timeframe for addressing.) The link isn't actually referencing a value set, it's referencing the entire code system. The best place to see what codes are available is here: https://browser.ihtsdotools.org
@Robert McClure @Rob Hausam - do we know when/if SNOMED Int'l ever intends to make http://snomed.info/sct resolve to something useful?

Well by default it resolves to our "What is SNOMED CT?" page: https://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/five-step-briefing Or it should do, please let me know if you see the existing dereferencing fail. We could discuss having it go to the CodeSystem endpoint on our browser if it detected application/fhir+json accept headers, but in the example Lital has found, we're working in a browser context, so human readable information seems appropriate.

Thanks @Robert McClure for the nudge.
You'll see the reply from Peter above that this is the usual landing for this sort of informational link. Wondering if this group is suggesting another landing point for this link?

Ah, so it does now. Yay - thank you!

So @Lital Inghel's issue is something different. The URL provided (http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/uslab-obs-codedresults) doesn't seem to resolve - can you paste the specific link of the page you're looking for when you see the broken link Lital?
